question: As per India State of Forest Report 2017, which of the following is the correct order of states in terms of area under bamboo production?
option2: Madhya Pradesh> Maharashtra> Arunachal Pradesh> Odisha
option4: Arunachal Pradesh> Madhya Pradesh> Chhattisgarh> Odisha
answer: Madhya Pradesh> Maharashtra> Arunachal Pradesh> Odisha
explanation: As per India State of Forest Report 2017, the current mangrove cover in the country has been reported to be 4921 sq km, which is .15% of the total geographical area of the country. As per the report, the mangrove forests have increased by 181 sq kms in the country compared to assessment made in 2015. Maharashtra has shown the maximum increase in area under bamboo cultivation among all other states. Maharashtra (82 sq kms), Andhra Pradesh (37 sq kms) and Gujarat (33 sq kms) are the top three gainers in terms of mangrove cover. 7 out of the 12 mangrove states have shown an increase in mangrove cover and none of them show any negative change. The correct order of states in terms of area under Bamboo cultivation is Madhya Pradesh> Maharashtra> Arunachal Pradesh> Odisha.
